photos.id: Billy Howard, Baby T, Atlanta, 1987. Photograph. Epitaphs for the Living by Billy Howard.
Baby T, Baby T’s handprint Atlanta, 1987. Photocopy of print. Epitaphs for the Living by Billy Howard.
Billy Howard, Juanita, Chapel Hill, 1988. Photograph. Epitaphs for the Living by Billy Howard.

Thomas McGovern, Activist James Baggett and friends carry the coffin of fellow activist, Jon Greenberg, through the streets of New York City during a political funeral, 1993.
Photograph. Bearing Witness (to AIDS) by Thomas McGovern.
Donna Binder, ACT UP travels to Atlanta during DNC, July 17-21, 1988. Photograph. David Zwirner’s More Life exhibition.

Dona Ann McAdams, Members of Women ACT UP lead the charge at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), Maryland, May 21, 1990.
Photograph. We Are Everywhere by Matthew Riemer and Leighton Brown.
Thomas McGovern, Demonstrators during an AIDS rally, Washington, D.C., November 1992. Photograph. Bearing Witness (to AIDS) by Thomas McGovern.

Andreas Sterzing, David Wojnarowicz (Silence = Death), New York, 1989.
Photograph, pigment print, 24 x 18 1/2 in. Delaware Art Museum.
Dona Ann McAdams, Political funeral of David Wojnarowicz, New York, July 1992. Photograph. We Are Everywhere by Matthew Riemer and Leighton Brown.
Taro Yamasaki, Ryan White with classmates by his locker in the hallway of Hamilton Heights High School, 1987. Photograph. https://taroyamasaki.com/ryan-white-5.

Sara Krulwich, Robert Sanford, suffering from AIDS-related blindness, playing piano at a recital at the Lighthouse, 1988.
Photograph. Loss, Bravery, and a Deadly Disease, The New York Times, December 3, 2018.

Fred Conrad, Chelli Jackson singing to her foster child, who has AIDS, April 29, 1988.
Photograph. AIDS Babies Find Love With Foster Parents, The New York Times, May 7, 1988.

Mark Morrisroe, Untitled (John S. and Jonathan), 1985.
Photograph, chromogenic print, negative sandwich, processed, 13 x 19 3/16 in. Whitney Museum of American Art.
Nan Goldin, Cookie and Vittorio's wedding, 1986. Photograph, cibachrome print, 9 1/8 x 13 1/2. The Ballad of Sexual Dependency by Nan Goldin.
Nan Goldin, Cookie at Vittorio's Casket, New York City, September 1989. Photograph, cibachrome print, 33 x 49 cm. The Ballad of Sexual Dependency by Nan Goldin.
